Text: Re Response to PX Answer to Chargeback Complaintfor the draft We are informed that the PX has filed in Chapter It may argue that FERCs proceedings fall within the automatic stay and that even if they dont the accounting we are proposing inappropriately overlaps the role of the bankruptcy court

Re Proposal re CalPX Methodologies This communication may contain information that is legally privileged confidential or exempt from disclosure If you are not the intended recipient please do not read disseminate distribute or copy this communication Anyone who receives this message in error should notify the sender immediately by telephone or by return email and delete it from his or her computer Thank you On preliminary review of the Draft Proposal I wonder whether if adopted by the Chargeback Complainants and the Participants Committee it should be submitted to the Commission in the Chargeback Docket not in Judge Birchmans proceeding under the July Order That order limits Judge Birchman to making findings of fact and certifying the record on the mitigated price in each hour of the refund period the amount of refunds owed by each supplier according to the prescribed methodology and the amount currently owed to each supplier with separate quantities due from each entity by the ISO the investor owned utilities and the State of California Mimeo at If the settlement were submitted in the Chargeback docket the Commission could refer it to Birchman with appropriate instructions as to how he should treat it when he certifies the record and his findings Or FERC could hold the settlement until after Birchmans report This brings up timing questions The July Order directed the ALJ to certify the record and findings days after receiving the CAISOs hourbyhour reconstruction of mitigated prices between October and June Under Judge Birchmans Order of August establishing a trial schedule attached final ISO data wont be submitted until September which pushes the certification and finding date to November We need to think about how the schedule shown in the attached order impacts the timing and method of bringing the settlement before FERC assuming that the proposals wording and substance are accepted by all Chargeback Complainants and the Official Committee Howard E Shapiro elcfdoc
